books.title: Pride and Prejudice11111111
books.author: Jane Austen
books.authorInfo: Jane Austen was an English novelist known for her works of romantic fiction, including 'Pride and Prejudice' and 'Sense and Sensibility.'
books.bookInfo: A witty and romantic exploration of societal expectations, love, and individual growth, this novel follows Elizabeth Bennet as she navigates misunderstandings and her evolving feelings for the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

books.author: George Orwell
books.authorInfo: George Orwell was an English writer famous for his dystopian novels '1984' and 'Animal Farm.'
books.bookInfo: This dystopian masterpiece imagines a totalitarian future where surveillance, propaganda, and oppression define daily life. Winston Smith secretly rebels against the Party and its omnipresent leader, Big Brother.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.authorInfo: J.D. Salinger was an American writer best known for his novel 'The Catcher in the Rye,' a classic of modern literature.
books.bookInfo: A coming-of-age novel that captures the alienation and disillusionment of youth, it follows Holden Caulfield as he wanders through New York City after being expelled from prep school.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.authorInfo: J.R.R. Tolkien was an English author and philologist, famous for 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings' series.
books.bookInfo: An epic fantasy adventure that follows Bilbo Baggins, a reluctant hobbit, as he joins a group of dwarves on a quest to reclaim their mountain home and its treasure from the dragon Smaug.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.authorInfo: Ray Bradbury was an American author known for his works of science fiction and dystopian literature, including 'Fahrenheit 451.'
books.bookInfo: In a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them, Montag begins to question his role and society's suppression of knowledge after meeting a free-thinking neighbor.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.authorInfo: Aldous Huxley was an English writer and philosopher, renowned for his novel 'Brave New World.'
books.bookInfo: Set in a futuristic world where technology and social engineering dominate, this novel explores themes of individuality, freedom, and the costs of a utopian society.
